Feral vampyres are dangerous creatures found in the Haunted Woods east of Canifis and near the Abandoned Mine. They are weaker, devolved vampyre juvinates, and are a much more animalistic creature than the other vampyres. Unlike most vampyres, they are vulnerable to all weapon types, not just silver and blisterwood. However, when attacked by a player wearing a holy symbol, they will receive a 25% reduction to their Attack and Defence.

They will occasionally bite players' necks, which can sometimes drain combat stats and will cause the feral vampyre to recover a small amount of life points.

Locations[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Requirements Spawns Map
East of the Abandoned Mine61None6Maplink
Haunted Woods61None17Maplink

Hunting and rewards[edit | edit source]

Feral vampyres are usually hunted for the Slayer skill. They offer mediocre to decent value drops, depending on the price of vampyre dust.

A good spot to kill feral vampyres is the south-east corner of the woods, just outside the wall gate of Port Phasmatys. Using a cannon in this area would be useful because there are many safe spots, which include the huge mushrooms and trees, where players may hide and not receive damage.

Players hunting feral vampyres for Slayer tasks may wish to hunt the feral vampyres at the Abandoned Mine, due to the presence of leeches in the Haunted Woods which can be frustrating to deal with when trying to finish a task quickly. However, the leeches become unaggressive at combat level 107.

Feral vampyres become unaggressive to players who have been given Vanescula's blood mark during The Branches of Darkmeyer.

Characteristics and history[edit | edit source]

Feral vampyres are savage beasts that were once Vampyre Juveniles and Juvinates, but have become considerably less intelligent, and have much less control over their powers. They are driven by their hunger and a kind of primal rage, unlike most other vampyric beings.[1]. Mod Ana later stated that this lore is still relevant [2]. Players are able to turn juveniles and juvinates into a similar state with the use of a Guthix balance potion.

Feral vampyres reside outside the settlements in Morytania, likely cast out by the more intelligent beings in the area. Most of them can be found in the Haunted Woods and near the Abandoned Mine.

Drops[edit | edit source]

Drop rates estimated based on 5,888 samples from the Drop Log Project, unless otherwise cited.

The average Feral vampyre kill is worth 3,124 coins.

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • patch 10 August 2020 (Update):
    • Feral vampyres are now a bit less feral and will no longer attack the player as soon as they arrive after using the Fairy Ring network
  • patch 26 February 2018 (Update):.
    • Feral vampyres are no longer aggressive to players who have been given Vanescula's blood mark.
  • ninja 20 July 2015 (Update):
    • Vampyres in the Haunted Woods have been renamed to feral vampyres.
  • patch 16 January 2012 (Update):
    • Vampyres are no longer referred to as "Vampires" in the Slayer skill.
  • patch 6 September 2011 (Update):
    • The vampyres east of Burgh de Rott can now count toward Slayer tasks.
  • update 14 October 2004 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Vampyres were graphically updated on 17 August 2011.
  • The different levels of vampyre each have different sounds when attacking, but they all have the same sound when attempting to bite you.
  • They appear to wear a damaged version of a Vampyre Juvinate's outfit.
  • Feral vampyres used to be called vampires, but this was changed on 31 August 2011 in a hidden update for an unknown reason. Their name was changed yet again on 20 July 2015 to their current name in order to differentiate them from the other members of their race.
  • There is a non-attackable spider in the Haunted Woods that would follow players around and spawn a feral vampyre that leaps down from above with a different examine text.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Postbag 19 - "Transcript:The vampyres explain themselves", Letter 4, by Solomon Lamescus. RuneScape Postbags from the Hedge.
  2. ^ Mod Ana. "^+^ Myreque Future V3 ^+^." 3 October 2011. (Archived from the original on 10 October 2011.) Future Game Updates Forums.
